content: passing this on to the board not necessarily for comment, (but comment if you will) but to let all know about a organization that i am proud to hold membership. I have not received a M1 in this program but my bride and i have donated M1's to this organization, and it has been very successful, some of you know the pains both physical and emotional that one goes thru when wounded, and when a young man is given one of these and you see the lights come back in their eyes it is worth every bit, this young man was injured while on combat ops in Iraq, lost vision in one eye and has steel in his skull, he was awarded the m1 in dec last year and his wife came to me crying and said that she now has a husband again and he actually wants to start doing things again and i beleive it was the M1 for vets program. just wanted to share some of this with you guys and to also say that this is not a formal dod event, nor is it a 'official sanctioned' event it is just a bunch of old farts like me that help out the youngsters, in our own little way here is some more information in case someone might want to participate regards ""http://www.m1forvets.com/About_M1_for_Vets.php"
reply: passing this on to the board not necessarily for comment, (but comment if you will) but to let all know about a organization that i am proud to hold membership. I have not received a M1 in this program but my bride and i have donated M1's to this organization, and it has been very successful, some of you know the pains both physical and emotional that one goes thru when wounded, and when a young man is given one of these and you see the lights come back in their eyes it is worth every bit, this young man was injured while on combat ops in Iraq, lost vision in one eye and has steel in his skull, he was awarded the m1 in dec last year and his wife came to me crying and said that she now has a husband again and he actually wants to start doing things again and i beleive it was the M1 for vets program. just wanted to share some of this with you guys and to also say that this is not a formal dod event, nor is it a 'official sanctioned' event it is just a bunch of old farts like me that help out the youngsters, in our own little way here is some more information in case someone might want to participate regards ""http://www.m1forvets.com/About_M1_for_Vets.php"

content: quote: Originally posted by Elesso: could you explain the M1? i do not think i have EVER heard of it...or maybe i know it under a diffrent name... thanks Scott The M1 for vets program is funds that are raised that will purchase the old M1 rifles to be given to vets to participate in the National Matches. Helps them to get motivated again.
quote: Originally posted by Elesso: could you explain the M1? i do not think i have EVER heard of it...or maybe i know it under a diffrent name... thanks Scott
reply: The M1 for vets program is funds that are raised that will purchase the old M1 rifles to be given to vets to participate in the National Matches. Helps them to get motivated again.
title: an event and a organization that remembers wounded vets

content: quote: Originally posted by ELLIOTT1980: Thank You Ira for your Honorable and Selfless Service to our Wounded Warriors. GOD Bless Our Warriors and those that help them. You have my eternal respect and appreciation for your deeds. i wish i had a picture of this and i might if i dig long enough, but we had a young Marine, lost his left arm, and both legs below the knee. I was able to work up a position with his prosthesus for left arm and he was able to do a rapid fire relay, load two shoot them and load eight more and complete the course in less than 60 seconds...... and the group he shot was about the size of a softball. want to see a bunch of old farts cry............ this year we hope to pass out 100 M1's all completely re habed to 100%seviceable condition and ready to issue. wouldn't it be great though to next year no more wounded warriors
quote: Originally posted by ELLIOTT1980: Thank You Ira for your Honorable and Selfless Service to our Wounded Warriors. GOD Bless Our Warriors and those that help them. You have my eternal respect and appreciation for your deeds.
reply: i wish i had a picture of this and i might if i dig long enough, but we had a young Marine, lost his left arm, and both legs below the knee. I was able to work up a position with his prosthesus for left arm and he was able to do a rapid fire relay, load two shoot them and load eight more and complete the course in less than 60 seconds...... and the group he shot was about the size of a softball. want to see a bunch of old farts cry............ this year we hope to pass out 100 M1's all completely re habed to 100%seviceable condition and ready to issue. wouldn't it be great though to next year no more wounded warriors

LAST YEAR I PARTICIPATED WITH THE "M1 FOR VETS" And had the distinct honor and pleasure to win the overall Garand Match senior division, This year i will (by Gods Grace) participate again, and i will use a 1943 M1 Garand. And also this year my wife and i will host a bar b que for all the participants. Not a big deal, but just a bunch of wounded vets some in wheel chairs some hurt in different ways all share a comraderie. You go on line, pay the entry fees, and you can use my M1, or i can bring a extra M1 if you would prefer to use a different one "http://www.odcmp.com/NationalMatches.htm" it is your choice, but it will be a event that you will remember for the rest of your life and if you have donated funds to the Military Order of the Purple Heart, thank you, all of my childred received scholarships thru that organization, all attended University's and State Colleges and graduated, UNC, Missouri State. If you did participate thru donations then you helped my children gradate

content: quote: M-14, or a springfield rifle, or a thompson machine gun M14 IS FULL AUTO CAPABLE LICENSE IS EXPENSIVE AND SO IS RIFLE, CLOSE TO 13K FOR A M14 IF YOU CAN FIND ONE, ALL STATE OWNED M14'S HAD TO BE TURNED BACK TO US GOV FOR POTENTIAL ISSUE TO COMNBAT TROOPS, STATE USED TO HAVE M14'S TO ISSUE FOR COMPETITION TO LEGITIMATE COMPETITORS THOMPSON IS FULL AUTO, LICENSE IS EXPENSIVE AND SO IS WEAPON, VERY VERY COSTLY SPRINGFIELDS ARE JUST NOT AVAILABLE IN NUMBERS M1 WAS THE KING OF BATTLE RIFLES I DO NOT HAVE PATIENTS, I HAVE FRIENDS THAT COME TO ME FOR ASSISTANCE AT TIME MY APOLOGY IS THIS: I WILL BE ON THE FIRING LINE IN AUG WILL YOU?
quote: M-14, or a springfield rifle, or a thompson machine gun
reply: M14 IS FULL AUTO CAPABLE LICENSE IS EXPENSIVE AND SO IS RIFLE, CLOSE TO 13K FOR A M14 IF YOU CAN FIND ONE, ALL STATE OWNED M14'S HAD TO BE TURNED BACK TO US GOV FOR POTENTIAL ISSUE TO COMNBAT TROOPS, STATE USED TO HAVE M14'S TO ISSUE FOR COMPETITION TO LEGITIMATE COMPETITORS THOMPSON IS FULL AUTO, LICENSE IS EXPENSIVE AND SO IS WEAPON, VERY VERY COSTLY SPRINGFIELDS ARE JUST NOT AVAILABLE IN NUMBERS M1 WAS THE KING OF BATTLE RIFLES I DO NOT HAVE PATIENTS, I HAVE FRIENDS THAT COME TO ME FOR ASSISTANCE AT TIME MY APOLOGY IS THIS: I WILL BE ON THE FIRING LINE IN AUG WILL YOU?

title: an event and a organization that remembers wounded vets

content: springfield target rifles from 30's long range springfields top one is used at 1000 yards, when i had eyeballs i could hold a 6' group at 1k, but now 15" is about my best THE BOTTOM ONE IS A 22, BOTH FROM THIRTIES after WWII we loaned 03's to Greece here is one that has been returned and it is a remington 03 (1942) some 03' top one is a four digit serial number and is a wwi vet do you get to shoot your M1, if so need to come to camp butner for the spring creedmore games and eastern cmp games, there will be a mi match 2 may thru 11 may. i have entered and will compete, but all are welcome and it is a good time regards Ira
reply: springfield target rifles from 30's long range springfields top one is used at 1000 yards, when i had eyeballs i could hold a 6' group at 1k, but now 15" is about my best THE BOTTOM ONE IS A 22, BOTH FROM THIRTIES after WWII we loaned 03's to Greece here is one that has been returned and it is a remington 03 (1942) some 03' top one is a four digit serial number and is a wwi vet do you get to shoot your M1, if so need to come to camp butner for the spring creedmore games and eastern cmp games, there will be a mi match 2 may thru 11 may. i have entered and will compete, but all are welcome and it is a good time regards Ira
